summary: "The National Anthem," the first episode of the TV series *Black Mirror*, is about a weird crisis: a royal family member is kidnapped, and the kidnapper demands that the Prime Minister, Michael Callow, has sex with a pig on live TV to secure their release. The episode explores how the government, media, and public react to this bizarre situation. It was written by Charlie Brooker and directed by Otto Bathurst, airing in 2011. The story highlights the power of social media and the pressure on politicians. It was inspired by an idea Brooker had years before, and it sparked many discussions about its themes.
title: The National Anthem (Black Mirror)
